annotation.spannedText: A person fully vaccinated against measles has contracted the disease and passed it on to others

classMention.mentionClass: A person fully vaccinated against measles has contracted the disease and passed it on to others

annotation.spannedText: When it comes to the measles vaccine, two shots are better than one

classMention.mentionClass: When it comes to the measles vaccine, two shots are better than one

annotation.spannedText: If it turns out that vaccinated people lose their immunity as they get older, that could leave them vulnerable to measles outbreaks seeded by unvaccinated people—which are increasingly common in the United States and other developed countries

classMention.mentionClass: If it turns out that vaccinated people lose their immunity as they get older, that could leave them vulnerable to measles outbreaks seeded by unvaccinated people—which are increasingly common in the United States and other developed countries

annotation.spannedText: The most important ‘vaccine failure’ with measles happens when people refuse the vaccine in the first place

classMention.mentionClass: The most important ‘vaccine failure’ with measles happens when people refuse the vaccine in the first place

annotation.spannedText: Robert Jacobson, director of clinical studies for the Mayo Clinic’s Vaccine Research Group in Rochester, Minnesota

classMention.mentionClass: Robert Jacobson, director of clinical studies for the Mayo Clinic’s Vaccine Research Group in Rochester, Minnesota
